law.text: Whenever the Uniform Commercial Code creates a "presumption" with respect to a fact, or provides that a fact is "presumed," the trier of fact must find the existence of the fact unless and until evidence is introduced that supports a finding of its nonexistence.
law.history: Repealed and reenacted 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 242, sec. 14, effective July 12, 2006. -- Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 130, sec. 180, effective January 1, 1997. -- Created 1958 Ky. Acts ch. 77, sec. 1-206, effective July 1, 1960.
